response.answer_text: Tragedy is such a large category that it has its own genre. When we speak of the tragedies of Shakespeare, they are a category unto themselves. However, I believe tragedy can also be a theme. For instance, one might call the primary theme of Sylvia Plath’s poetry the tragedy or tragedies of her personal life.

“Theme” is not the name of the category that includes tragedy, comedy, etc. But tragedy can be a theme, in an essay about theatre, for existence. It is also possible to have a tragedy with tragedy as a theme, such as the classic science-fiction story, The Darfsteller, by Walter M. Miller.
